oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Camp woodworking shop, 223rd Co. C.C.C., TVA P-10, Powell Station, Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Haslbauer, Otto F.
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For current rights information, please visit: http://idserver.utk.edu/?id=200600000001200
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This slightly-damaged photograph show the camp woodworking shop of the Civilian Conservation Corps' 223rd Company, TVA P-10, Powell Station, Tennessee. Three C.C.C. workers use woodworking equipment. A sign on the wall reads "CCC teaches safety." Otto F. Haslbauer donated this photograph.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Civilian Conservation Corps .S.) -- FACILITIES -- 1930-1950

Woodworking.
Tennessee Valley Authority and "grass roots democracy" .

oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: The Great Depression and World War II (1929-1945).
